Consider two lines: line $l$ parameterized as
\begin{align*} 
x &= 1 + 4t,\\
y &=  4 + 3t
\end{align*}and the line $m$ parameterized as
\begin{align*} 
x &=-5  + 4s\\
y &=  6 + 3s.
\end{align*}Let $A$ be a point on line $l$, $B$ be a point on line $m$, and let $P$ be the foot of the perpendicular from $A$ to line $m$.

Then $\overrightarrow{BP}$ is the projection of $\overrightarrow{BA}$ onto some vector $\begin{pmatrix} v_1\\v_2\end{pmatrix}$ such that $v_1+v_2 = -7$. Find $\begin{pmatrix}v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}$.
inference:
The vector $\overrightarrow{BA}$ is given by
$$\overrightarrow{BA} = \begin{pmatrix} -5 - (1 + 4t) \\ 6 - (4 + 3t) \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -6 - 4t \\ 2 - 3t \end{pmatrix}.$$

The vector $\overrightarrow{BP}$ is the projection of $\overrightarrow{BA}$ onto the vector $\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}$, so we have
$$\overrightarrow{BP} = \frac{\overrightarrow{BA} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}}{\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}} \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} = \frac{-6v_1 - 4tv_1 + 2v_2 - 3tv_2}{v_1^2 + v_2^2} \begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix}.$$

Since $\overrightarrow{BP}$ is perpendicular to line $m$, we have
$$\overrightarrow{BP} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} = 0,$$

which gives
$$4(-6v_1 - 4tv_1 + 2v_2 - 3tv_2) + 3(2v_1 + 3tv_1) = 0.$$

Simplifying, we get
$$-24v_1 - 16tv_1 + 8v_2 - 12tv_2 + 6v_1 + 9tv_1 = 0,$$

which gives
$$-18v_1 - 7tv_1 + 8v_2 = 0.$$

Since $v_1 + v_2 = -7$, we have $v_2 = -7 - v_1$, so we can substitute this into the above equation to get
$$-18v_1 - 7tv_1 + 8(-7 - v_1) = 0.$$

Simplifying, we get
$$-18v_1 - 7tv_1 - 56 - 8v_1 = 0,$$

which gives
$$-26v_1 - 7tv_1 = 56.$$

Dividing by $-7$, we get
$$v_1 + tv_1 = -8.$$

Since $v_1 + v_2 = -7$, we have $v_2 = -7 - v_1$, so we can substitute this into the above equation to get
$$v_1 + t(-7 - v_1) = -8.$$

Simplifying, we get
$$v_1 - 7t - tv_1 = -8,$$

which gives
$$-6t = -8,$$

so $t = \frac{4}{3}$.

Substituting this back into $v_1 + tv_1 = -8$, we get
$$v_1 + \frac{4}{3}v_1 = -8,$$

which gives
$$\frac{7}{3}v_1 = -8,$$

so $v_1 = -\frac{24}{7}$.

Therefore, $v_2 = -7 - v_1 = -7 - \left(-\frac{24}{7}\right) = -\frac{9}{7}$, so
$$\begin{pmatrix} v_1 \\ v_2 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -\frac{24}{7} \\ -\frac{9}{7} \end{pmatrix}.$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$\begin{pmatrix} -\frac{24}{7} \\ -\frac{9}{7} \end{pmatrix}$. I hope it is correct.}
